name: Integrated Delivery System (IDS)
description: Coordinated network of healthcare providers offering comprehensive services across continuum of care
participating_entities: Hospitals, clinics, physician practices, specialists, ancillary services
benefits: Coordinated care, seamless transitions, shared medical records, preventive focus
characteristics: Organized healthcare arrangement where all participating entities are under common ownership or control

name: Healthcare Coalition
description: Multi-organizational network formed for disaster response and emergency preparedness
participating_entities: Hospitals, EMS, public health, mental health, pharmacies, providers
benefits: Coordinated emergency response, resource sharing, communication protocols
characteristics: Participants agree to share PHI for public health emergency response activities

name: Clinically Integrated Network (CIN)
description: Organized network of healthcare providers using data and IT to improve quality and reduce costs
participating_entities: Physicians, hospitals, specialists, post-acute care providers
benefits: Shared clinical protocols, quality metrics, cost analysis, coordinated care
characteristics: Electronic connectivity, shared data, aligned incentives, legal agreements among participants

name: Health Information Exchange (HIE)
description: Organization facilitating sharing of health information among providers and health plans
participating_entities: EHR vendors, hospitals, clinics, health plans, care coordination entities
benefits: Interoperability, electronic health records access, care coordination, reduced duplication
characteristics: Common electronic infrastructure, governance structure, participant agreements

name: Accountable Care Organization (ACO)
description: Entity organized to manage financial and clinical risks and improve care delivery
participating_entities: Primary care physicians, specialists, hospitals, skilled nursing, home health
benefits: Value-based payment, quality metrics, shared savings, coordinated care management
characteristics: CMS-recognized organization with shared financial and clinical accountability

name: Managed Care Network
description: Organized network of healthcare providers and facilities under managed care arrangements
participating_entities: Primary care physicians, specialists, hospitals, pharmacies, ancillary providers
benefits: Network efficiency, cost containment, care management, preventive services
characteristics: Common management controls, network agreements, shared incentives

name: Patient-Centered Medical Home Network
description: Coordinated network of primary care practices emphasizing access and coordination
participating_entities: Primary care clinics, specialists, behavioral health, social services
benefits: Patient engagement, care coordination, preventive care, quality improvement
characteristics: Designated primary care practices with coordination capabilities

name: Specialty Care Network
description: Organized network focused on specific disease or condition management
participating_entities: Specialty practices, disease management organizations, rehabilitation services, patient advocacy
benefits: Specialized expertise, disease-specific protocols, outcomes tracking, patient support
characteristics: Formal agreements among organizations sharing common treatment protocols

name: Mental Health and Substance Use Network
description: Integrated network providing behavioral health and substance use treatment services
participating_entities: Mental health clinics, substance use treatment, primary care, hospitals, peer support
benefits: Integrated behavioral health, reduced stigma, comprehensive treatment, recovery support
characteristics: Shared governance, coordinated care planning, integrated IT systems

name: Community Health Center Consortium
description: Network of federally qualified health centers and community clinics
participating_entities: FQHCs, community health centers, safety-net providers, public health agencies
benefits: Access for underserved populations, coordinated care, prevention focus, health equity
characteristics: Shared mission, coordinated networks, community-based governance
